post.summary: Perform continuous gene set analysis on gene expression data
post.description:
Parameters
----------
gene_names : List[str]
    Name of the column containing gene names.

log_fold_change : List[str]
    Name of the column containing log fold change values.

species : <class 'str'>
    Species of the gene expression data. Should be one of 'rat', 'mouse', or 'human'.

permutations : <class 'int'>
    Number of permutations for statistical analysis.

source : <class 'str'>
    The type of analysis to perform. Should be one of 'go', 'reactome',
'wikipathways', 'phenotype', 'indra-upstream', or 'indra-downstream'.

alpha : <class 'float'>
    The significance level. Defaults to 0.05.

keep_insignificant : <class 'bool'>
    Whether to keep statistically insignificant results. Defaults to False.

minimum_evidence_count : <class 'int'>
    Minimum number of evidence required for INDRA analysis. Defaults to 1.

minimum_belief : <class 'float'>
    Minimum belief score for INDRA analysis. Defaults to 0.

Returns
-------
<class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'>
    A DataFrame containing the results of the specified analysis.

post.summary: Perform discrete analysis on the provided genes
post.description:
Parameters
----------
gene_list : List[str]
    A list of gene identifiers. Can be HGNC symbols or identifiers.

method : <class 'str'>
    Statistical method to apply, by default 'fdr_bh'.

alpha : <class 'float'>
    Significance level, by default 0.05.

keep_insignificant : <class 'bool'>
    Whether to retain insignificant results, by default False.

minimum_evidence_count : <class 'int'>
    Minimum number of evidence for inclusion, by default 1.

minimum_belief : <class 'float'>
    Minimum belief score for filtering, by default 0.

indra_path_analysis : <class 'bool'>
    Whether to perform INDRA pathway analysis, by default False.

background_gene_list : List[str]
    A list of background genes of which the gene list is a part
to constrain the space of possible genes to consider
when calculating enrichment statistics.

Returns
-------
Dict[str, Union[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, NoneType]]
    A dict with results per analysis type in the form of a DataFrame or None
if an error occurs or no results are found.

post.summary: Check if a molecule is associated with an indication in ChEMBL data

by statement hash.

statement hashes.

post.summary: Maps UniProt IDs to HGNC IDs
post.description:
This method expects a JSON payload with a list of UniProt IDs under the key
"uniprot_ids". It returns a dictionary mapping each UniProt ID to its
corresponding HGNC ID, if available.

Returns
-------
:
    A dictionary where keys are UniProt IDs and values are HGNC IDs.

post.summary: Maps HGNC IDs to their corresponding names
post.description:
This method expects a JSON payload with a list of HGNC IDs under the key
"hgnc_ids". It retrieves the corresponding HGNC names using the `hgnc_client`
and returns a dictionary mapping each HGNC ID to its name.

Returns
-------
:
    A dictionary where keys are HGNC IDs and values are HGNC names.

post.summary: Return the statements based on optional constraints on relationship type and source(s)
post.description:
Parameters
----------
rel_types : Union[str, List[str], NoneType]
    The relationship type(s) to filter by, e.g., "Phosphorylation" or ["Phosphorylation", "Activation"].

stmt_sources : Union[str, List[str], NoneType]
    The source(s) to filter by, e.g., "reach" or ["reach", "sparser"].

agent : Union[str, Tuple[str, str]]
    The primary agent involved in the interaction. Can be specified as a name (e.g., "EGFR") or as a CURIE
tuple (namespace, ID), such as ("MESH", "D051379").

agent_role : Union[str, NoneType]
    The role of agent in the interaction: either "subject", "object", or None for an undirected search.

other_agent : Union[str, Tuple[str, str], NoneType]
    A secondary agent in the interaction, specified either as a name or CURIE tuple.

other_role : Union[str, NoneType]
    The role of other_agent in the interaction: either "subject", "object", or None.

paper_term : Union[Tuple[str, str], NoneType]
    The paper filter. Can be a PubMed ID, PMC id, TRID, or DOI

limit : Union[int, NoneType]
    The maximum number of statements to return.

evidence_limit : Union[int, NoneType]
    The optional maximum number of evidence entries to retrieve per statement.

Returns
-------
Union[List[indra.statements.statements.Statement], Tuple[List[indra.statements.statements.Statement], Mapping[int, int]]]
    A list of statements filtered by the provided constraints.

post.summary: Return the statements with evidence for the given MESH ID
post.description:
Parameters
----------
include_db_evidence : <class 'bool'>
    Whether to include db evidence or not

evidence_limit : <class 'int'>
    Maximum number of evidence per statement

mesh_term : Tuple[str, str]
    The MESH ID to query.

include_child_terms : <class 'bool'>
    If True, also match against the children of the given MESH ID.

Returns
-------
Union[Tuple[List[indra.statements.statements.Statement], Mapping[int, int]], Tuple[List[indra.statements.statements.Statement], NoneType]]
    The statements for the given MESH ID.

post.summary: Maps UniProt mnemonic IDs to UniProt IDs
post.description:
This method expects a JSON payload with a key "uniprot_mnemonic_ids"
containing a list of UniProt mnemonic IDs. It uses the UniProt client to
convert each mnemonic ID to a UniProt ID. Then, it adds the mapping from the
mnemonic ID to the UniProt ID to the result.

Returns
-------
:
    A dictionary mapping UniProt mnemonic IDs to UniProt IDs.

Parameters
----------
phenotype : Tuple[str, str]
    The phenotype to query (e.g., ("mesh", "D001827"))

Returns
-------
Iterable[indra_cogex.representation.Node]
    Variant nodes (DBSNP) associated with this phenotype

post.summary: Check if a gene has copy number alteration in the given cell line
post.description:
Parameters
----------
gene : Tuple[str, str]
    The gene to query (e.g., ("hgnc", "11216"))

cell_line : Tuple[str, str]
    The cell line to query (e.g., ("ccle", "U266B1_HAEMATOPOIETIC_AND_LYMPHOID_TISSUE"))

Returns
-------
Dict[str, bool]
    True if the gene has copy number alteration in the cell line

post.summary: Check if a gene has the given enzyme activity
post.description:
Parameters
----------
gene : Tuple[str, str]
    The gene to query (e.g., ("hgnc", "10007"))

enzyme : Tuple[str, str]
    The enzyme activity to query (e.g., ("ec-code", "3.4.21.105"))

Returns
-------
Dict[str, bool]
    True if the gene has the given enzyme activity

post.summary: Check if a gene is associated with a disease
post.description:
Parameters
----------
gene : Tuple[str, str]
    The gene to query (e.g., ("hgnc", "57"))

disease : Tuple[str, str]
    The disease to query (e.g., ("doid", "DOID:2738"))

Returns
-------
Dict[str, bool]
    True if the gene is associated with the disease

post.summary: Return True if the disease has the given phenotype
post.description:
Parameters
----------
disease : Tuple[str, str]
    The disease to query

phenotype : Tuple[str, str]
    The phenotype to query

Returns
-------
List[Any]
    True if the disease has the phenotype

post.summary: Return True if the phenotype is associated with the given gene
post.description:
Parameters
----------
phenotype : Tuple[str, str]
    The phenotype to query (MESH ID)

gene : Tuple[str, str]
    The gene to query (HGNC ID)

Returns
-------
Dict[str, bool]
    True if the phenotype is associated with the gene

post.summary: Check if a variant is associated with a disease
post.description:
Parameters
----------
variant : Tuple[str, str]
    The variant to query (e.g., ("dbsnp", "rs9994441"))

disease : Tuple[str, str]
    The disease to query (e.g., ("doid", "DOID:10652"))

Returns
-------
Dict[str, bool]
    True if the variant is associated with the disease

post.summary: Check if a variant is associated with a gene
post.description:
Parameters
----------
variant : Tuple[str, str]
    The variant to query (e.g., ("dbsnp", "rs74615166"))

gene : Tuple[str, str]
    The gene to query (e.g., ("hgnc", "12310"))

Returns
-------
Dict[str, bool]
    True if the variant is associated with the gene

post.summary: Check if a variant is associated with a phenotype in GWAS data
post.description:
Parameters
----------
variant : Tuple[str, str]
    The variant to query (e.g., ("dbsnp", "rs13015548"))

phenotype : Tuple[str, str]
    The phenotype to query (e.g., ("mesh", "D001827"))

Returns
-------
Dict[str, bool]
    True if the variant is associated with the phenotype

post.summary: Return the INDRA Statement subnetwork induced pairs of statements
post.description:
Parameters
----------
nodes : Iterable[Tuple[str, str]]
    The nodes to query.

order_by_ev_count : <class 'bool'>
    Whether to order the statements by evidence count in descending order.

Returns
-------
List[indra.statements.statements.Statement]
    The subnetwork induced by the given nodes.

post.summary: Return the INDRA Statement subnetwork induced by the given GO term
post.description:
Parameters
----------
include_db_evidence : <class 'bool'>
    Whether to include database evidence or not.

go_term : Tuple[str, str]
    The GO term to query. Example: ``("GO", "GO:0006915")``

include_indirect : <class 'bool'>
    Should ontological children of the given GO term
be queried as well? Defaults to False.

mediated : <class 'bool'>
    Should relations A->X->B be included for X not associated
to the given GO term? Defaults to False.

upstream_controllers : <class 'bool'>
    Should relations A<-X->B be included for upstream controller
X not associated to the given GO term? Defaults to False.

downstream_targets : <class 'bool'>
    Should relations A->X<-B be included for downstream target
X not associated to the given GO term? Defaults to False.

order_by_ev_count : <class 'bool'>
    Should the statements be ordered by evidence count? Defaults to False.

return_source_counts : <class 'bool'>
    Whether to return source counts as well as statements.

Returns
-------
Union[List[indra.statements.statements.Statement], Tuple[List[indra.statements.statements.Statement], Dict[int, Dict[str, int]]]]
    The INDRA statement subnetwork induced by GO term.

post.summary: Return the subnetwork induced by the given nodes as a list of metadata
post.description:
Parameters
----------
nodes : Iterable[Tuple[str, str]]
    The nodes to query.

Returns
-------
List[List[Any]]
    The subnetwork induced by the given nodes represented as a list of
metadata on relations. The elements of each list are:
CURIE of source node, CURIE of target node, statement type,
statement hash, source counts.

post.summary: Return the subnetwork induced by the given nodes as a set of Relations
post.description:
Parameters
----------
nodes : Iterable[Tuple[str, str]]
    The nodes to query.

include_db_evidence : <class 'bool'>
    Whether to include statements with database evidence.

Returns
-------
List[indra_cogex.representation.Relation]
    The subnetwork induced by the given nodes represented as Relation
objects.

post.summary: Return the INDRA Statement subnetwork induced by the given nodes and expressed in the given tissue
post.description:
Parameters
----------
nodes : List[Tuple[str, str]]
    The nodes to query.

tissue : Tuple[str, str]
    The tissue to query.

Returns
-------
List[indra.statements.statements.Statement]
    The subnetwork induced by the given nodes and expressed in the given tissue.

post.summary: Check if a cell line is sensitive to the given drug
post.description:
Parameters
----------
cell_line : Tuple[str, str]
    The cell line to query (e.g., ("ccle", "RL952_ENDOMETRIUM"))

drug : Tuple[str, str]
    The drug to query (e.g., ("mesh", "C586365"))

Returns
-------
Dict[str, bool]
    True if the cell line is sensitive to the drug

post.summary: Return True if the drug targets the given protein
post.description:
Parameters
----------
drug : Tuple[str, str]
    The drug to query.

target : Tuple[str, str]
    The target to query.

Returns
-------
Dict[str, bool]
    True if the drug targets the given protein.

post.summary: Return True if the gene is in the given pathway
post.description:
Parameters
----------
gene : Tuple[str, str]
    The gene to query.

pathway : Tuple[str, str]
    The pathway to query.

Returns
-------
Dict[str, bool]
    True if the gene is in the given pathway.

post.description:
Parameters
----------
gene : Tuple[str, str]
    The gene to query.

tissue : Tuple[str, str]
    The tissue to query.

Returns
-------
Dict[str, bool]
    True if the gene is expressed in the given tissue.

post.summary: Check if a gene is mutated in the given cell line
post.description:
Parameters
----------
gene : Tuple[str, str]
    The gene to query (e.g., ("hgnc", "11504"))

cell_line : Tuple[str, str]
    The cell line to query (e.g., ("ccle", "HEL_HAEMATOPOIETIC_AND_LYMPHOID_TISSUE"))

Returns
-------
Dict[str, bool]
    True if the gene is mutated in the cell line

post.summary: Return True if the given GO term is associated with the given gene
post.description:
Parameters
----------
gene : Tuple[str, str]
    The gene to query.

go_term : Tuple[str, str]
    The GO term to query.

Returns
-------
Dict[str, bool]
    True if the given GO term is associated with the given gene.

post.summary: Check if a journal is published by a specific publisher
post.description:
Parameters
----------
journal : Tuple[str, str]
    The journal to query (e.g., ("nlm", "100972832"))

publisher : Tuple[str, str]
    The publisher to query (e.g., ("isni", "0000000031304729"))

Returns
-------
List[Any]
    True if the journal is published by the given publisher

post.summary: Determines if the given genes are kinases
post.description:
This method expects a JSON payload with a list of genes under the key "genes".
It checks each gene to determine if it is a kinase using the
`hgnc_client.is_kinase` method and returns a mapping of each gene to a boolean
indicating whether it is a kinase.

Returns
-------
:
    A dictionary where the keys are gene names and the values are booleans
    indicating whether each gene is a kinase.

post.summary: Return True if the marker is associated with the given cell type
post.description:
Parameters
----------
marker : Tuple[str, str]
    The marker to query

cell_type : Tuple[str, str]
    The cell type to query

Returns
-------
List[Any]
    True if the marker is associated with the cell type

post.summary: Determines if the given genes are phosphatases
post.description:
This method expects a JSON payload with a list of gene identifiers under the
key "genes". It checks each gene to determine if it is a phosphatase using the
`hgnc_client.is_phosphatase` method. The result is a dictionary mapping each
gene to a boolean indicating whether it is a phosphatase.

Returns
-------
:
    A dictionary where keys are gene identifiers and values are booleans
    indicating if the gene is a phosphatase.

post.summary: Check if a publication was published in a specific journal
post.description:
Parameters
----------
publication : Tuple[str, str]
    The publication to query (e.g., ("pubmed", "14334679"))

journal : Tuple[str, str]
    The journal to query (e.g., ("nlm", "0000201"))

Returns
-------
Dict[str, bool]
    True if the publication was published in the given journal

post.summary: Return True if the given side effect is associated with the given drug
post.description:
Parameters
----------
drug : Tuple[str, str]
    The drug to query.

side_effect : Tuple[str, str]
    The side effect to query.

Returns
-------
Dict[str, bool]
    True if the given side effect is associated with the given drug.

post.summary: Determines if the given genes are transcription factors
post.description:
This method expects a JSON payload with a list of genes under the key "genes".
It checks each gene to determine if it is a transcription factor using the
`hgnc_client.is_transcription_factor` method and returns a mapping of genes
to their transcription factor status.

Returns
-------
:
    A dictionary where keys are gene names and values are booleans indicating
    whether the gene is a transcription factor.

post.summary: Return True if the given term is a child of the given parent
post.description:
Parameters
----------
term : Tuple[str, str]
    The term to query.

parent : Tuple[str, str]
    The parent to query.

Returns
-------
Dict[str, bool]
    True if the given term is a child term of the given parent.

post.summary: Perform discrete metabolite analysis and return results as a DataFrame
post.description:
Parameters
----------
metabolites : List[str]
    List of metabolite identifiers (CHEBI IDs or CHEBI names).

method : <class 'str'>
    Method to adjust p-values, default is family-wise correction with
Benjamini/Hochberg.

alpha : <class 'float'>
    Significance level, default is 0.05.

keep_insignificant : <class 'bool'>
    Whether to retain insignificant results, default is False.

minimum_evidence_count : <class 'int'>
    Minimum evidence count threshold, default is 1.

minimum_belief : <class 'float'>
    Minimum belief threshold for filtering results, default is 0.

Returns
-------
<class 'pandas.core.frame.DataFrame'>
    A DataFrame containing the analysis results.

post.summary: Perform signed analysis using reverse causal reasoning
post.description:
Parameters
----------
positive_genes : List[str]
    List of positive gene identifiers.

negative_genes : List[str]
    List of negative gene identifiers.

alpha : <class 'float'>
    Significance level, by default 0.05.

keep_insignificant : <class 'bool'>
    Whether to retain insignificant results, by default False.

minimum_evidence_count : <class 'int'>
    Minimum number of evidence for inclusion, by default 1.

minimum_belief : <class 'float'>
    Minimum belief score for filtering, by default 0.

Returns
-------
Union[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, NoneType]
    A DataFrame containing analysis results, or None if an error occurs.

info.title: INDRA CoGEx Query API
info.description: REST API for INDRA CoGEx queries

tags.name: Gene Expression Queries
tags.description: Query and validate gene expression patterns across different tissues

tags.name: GO Terms Queries
tags.description: Access and verify Gene Ontology term associations for genes

tags.name: Clinical Trials Queries
tags.description: Retrieve information about clinical trials and their relationships with drugs and diseases

tags.name: Biological Pathways Queries
tags.description: Explore relationships between genes and their biological pathways, including pathway sharing analysis

tags.name: Drug Side Effects Queries
tags.description: Query and validate drug side effects and their associations

tags.name: Ontology Queries
tags.description: Navigate hierarchical relationships in biological and medical ontologies

tags.name: Literature Metadata Queries
tags.description: Access and search scientific literature, journal, and publisher metadata

tags.name: Statements Queries
tags.description: Retrieve and analyze evidence statements and their associated metadata

tags.name: Drug Targets Queries
tags.description: Explore and validate relationships between drugs and their molecular targets

tags.name: Cell Markers Queries
tags.description: Query relationships between cell types and their molecular markers

tags.name: Disease-Phenotypes Association Queries
tags.description: Investigate associations between diseases and their phenotypic manifestations

tags.name: Gene-Disease-Variant Association Queries
tags.description: Analyze interconnected relationships between genes, diseases, and their genetic variants

tags.name: Project-Research Queries
tags.description: Query bidirectional relationships between NIH research projects and their associated outputs (publications, clinical trials, patents)

tags.name: Gene Domain Queries
tags.description: Query and validate protein domain associations for genes

tags.name: Phenotype-Variant Association Queries
tags.description: Explore relationships between genetic variants and phenotypes from GWAS studies

tags.name: Drug Indication Queries
tags.description: Access information about therapeutic uses and indications for drugs

tags.name: Gene Codependence Queries
tags.description: Analyze genetic dependencies and interactions between genes

tags.name: Enzyme Activity Queries
tags.description: Query enzymatic activities associated with genes and proteins

tags.name: Cell Line Property Queries
tags.description: Explore cell line characteristics including mutations, copy number alterations, and drug sensitivity

tags.name: Analysis Queries
tags.description: Perform statistical and biological data analysis

tags.name: Subnetwork Queries
tags.description: Explore biological subnetwork relationships and pathways

tags.name: BioEntity
tags.description: Queries for BioEntity

ParseError.description: When a mask can't be parsed

MaskError.description: When any error occurs on mask
